Here, we introduce a series of versatile genome-scan methods that are based on non-parametric k -nearest neighbors (kNN) techniques, while incorporating pairwise Fixation Index ( F ST ) estimates and pairwise nucleotide differences ( d xy ) as features. Simulations were performed for both positive directional selection and introgression, with varying parameters, such as recombination rates, population background histories, the proportion of introgression, and the time of gene flow.
